extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map()
      Constructor: a default 20 x 20 game with 10 walkers, 10 pillars, and 20 blocks placed randomly throughout the game grid.

    • Field Detail

      • frame

        public javax.swing.JFrame frame

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map()
        Constructor: a default 20 x 20 game with 10 walkers, 10 pillars, and 20 blocks placed randomly throughout the game grid.

      • Map

        public Map(int h,
           int w,
           int bl,
           int wa,
           int pi)
        Constructor: a game with an h x w grid with bl blocks, wa walkers, and pi pillars. J#Man is at position (0, 0), and all other pieces are placed randomly. Precondition: number of pieces specified is <= h*w.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] pars)
        Start a game 20x20 game wih 10 walkers, 10 pillars, and 20 blocks.

      • putNew

        public void putNew(int typ,
                   int x,
                   int y)
        If (x, y) is in the grid and empty, put a new piece of type typ in location (x, y); and, if the new piece is J*Man, store it in field jMan. Precondition: typ is one of the piece constants in class Piece.

      • isInGrid

        public boolean isInGrid(int x,
                        int y)
        = "(x, y) is inside the grid".

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(int x,
                       int y)
        = "(x, y) is inside the grid and does not contain a piece'.

      • pieceAt

        public Piece pieceAt(int x,
                     int y)
        = the Piece on tile (x, y) (null if (x, y) is outside the grid or contains null).

      • move

        public void move(int fromX,
                 int fromY,
                 int toX,
                 int toY)
        Move the Piece at (fromX, fromY) to (toX, toY) on the grid, changing the position at (fromX, fromY) to null; change the position in the Piece accordingly. The piece originall in (toX, toY) is permanently deleted. Precondition: 1. (toX, toY) is inside the grid. 2. The move is allowed by the game.

      • act

        public void act()
        Make every piece in the map act. When all have acted, reset all their has-acted flags to false.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Process a button push: call a function accordingly. Thus, if the button was Up, Down, Left, or Right, call function JMan.step with arg 0, 1, 2 or 3 respectively, and then call procedure act(). If the button newGame, open a dialog and ask whether a new game is desired and act accordingly. After all is done, repaint the game board.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
